oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of benzo-fused medium ring cyclic ethers via a Michael addition–ring closing metathesis strategy involving nitroaliphatic compounds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: DEB, INDUBHUSAN
JOHN, SUMOD
NAMBOOTHIRI, IRISHI NN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: michael addition
nitroaliphatic compounds
ring closing metathesis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nitroalkenes derived from O-protected salicylaldehyde undergo facile Michael-type addition of nucleophiles possessing unsaturated tether. Ring closing metathesis of the Michael adducts provides benzo-fused medium ring cyclic ethers possessing a nitroalkyl functionality.
